public class DataInputStream : Java.IO.FilterInputStream, IDisposable, Java.Interop.IJavaPeerable, Java.IO.IDataInput

.class public auto ansi beforefieldinit DataInputStream extends Java.IO.FilterInputStream implements class Android.Runtime.IJavaObject, class Java.Interop.IJavaPeerable, class Java.IO.IDataInput, class System.IDisposable
type DataInputStream = class inherit FilterInputStream interface IDataInput interface IJavaObject interface IDisposable interface IJavaPeerable

Docs.summary: A data input stream lets an application read primitive Java data types from an underlying input stream in a machine-independent way.

remarks.para: A data input stream lets an application read primitive Java data types from an underlying input stream in a machine-independent way. An application uses a data output stream to write data that can later be read by a data input stream.
DataInputStream is not necessarily safe for multithreaded access. Thread safety is optional and is the responsibility of users of methods in this class.
Added in 1.0.
Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

MemberSignature.Value: Public Overrides NotOverridable Function Read (b As Byte()) As Integer
public override sealed int Read (byte[]? b);
.method public hidebysig virtual instance int32 Read(unsigned int8[] b) cil managed

Docs.param: the buffer into which the data is read.
Docs.summary: Reads some number of bytes from the contained input stream and stores them into the buffer array b.
Docs.returns: the total number of bytes read into the buffer, or -1 if there is no more data because the end of the stream has been reached.

remarks.para: Reads some number of bytes from the contained input stream and stores them into the buffer array b. The number of bytes actually read is returned as an integer. This method blocks until input data is available, end of file is detected, or an exception is thrown.

If b is null, a NullPointerException is thrown. If the length of b is zero, then no bytes are read and 0 is returned; otherwise, there is an attempt to read at least one byte. If no byte is available because the stream is at end of file, the value -1 is returned; otherwise, at least one byte is read and stored into b.

The first byte read is stored into element b[0], the next one into b[1], and so on. The number of bytes read is, at most, equal to the length of b. Let k be the number of bytes actually read; these bytes will be stored in elements b[0] through b[k-1], leaving elements b[k] through b[b.length-1] unaffected.
The read(b) method has the same effect as: <blockquote>
Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

MemberSignature.Value: Public Overrides NotOverridable Function Read (b As Byte(), off As Integer, len As Integer) As Integer
public: override int Read(cli::array <System::Byte> ^ b, int off, int len);
public override sealed int Read (byte[]? b, int off, int len);
.method public hidebysig virtual instance int32 Read(unsigned int8[] b, int32 off, int32 len) cil managed
override this.Read : byte[] * int * int -> int

Docs.param: the buffer into which the data is read.
the start offset in the destination array b
the maximum number of bytes read.
Docs.summary: Reads up to len bytes of data from the contained input stream into an array of bytes.
Docs.returns: the total number of bytes read into the buffer, or -1 if there is no more data because the end of the stream has been reached.

remarks.para: Reads up to len bytes of data from the contained input stream into an array of bytes. An attempt is made to read as many as len bytes, but a smaller number may be read, possibly zero. The number of bytes actually read is returned as an integer.
This method blocks until input data is available, end of file is detected, or an exception is thrown.

If len is zero, then no bytes are read and 0 is returned; otherwise, there is an attempt to read at least one byte. If no byte is available because the stream is at end of file, the value -1 is returned; otherwise, at least one byte is read and stored into b.

The first byte read is stored into element b[off], the next one into b[off+1], and so on. The number of bytes read is, at most, equal to len. Let k be the number of bytes actually read; these bytes will be stored in elements b[off] through b[off+k-1], leaving elements b[off+k] through b[off+len-1] unaffected.
In every case, elements b[0] through b[off] and elements b[off+len] through b[b.length-1] are unaffected.

format.a: Java documentation for java.io.DataInputStream.read(byte[], int, int).

remarks.para: Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance string ReadLine() cil managed
abstract member ReadLine : unit -> string override this.ReadLine : unit -> string

Docs.summary: See the general contract of the readLine method of DataInput.
Docs.returns: the next line of text from this input stream.

remarks.para: See the general contract of the readLine method of DataInput.
Bytes for this operation are read from the contained input stream.

This member is deprecated. This method does not properly convert bytes to characters. As of JDK 1.1, the preferred way to read lines of text is via the BufferedReader.readLine() method. Programs that use the DataInputStream class to read lines can be converted to use the BufferedReader class by replacing code of the form: 
                DataInputStream d = new DataInputStream(in);
with: 
                BufferedReader d
                     = new BufferedReader(new InputStreamReader(in));
Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

MemberSignature.Value: Public Shared Function ReadUTF (in As IDataInput) As String
.method public static hidebysig string ReadUTF(class Java.IO.IDataInput in) cil managed

Docs.summary: Reads from the stream in a representation of a Unicode character string encoded in modified UTF-8 format; this string of characters is then returned as a String.

remarks.para: Reads from the stream in a representation of a Unicode character string encoded in modified UTF-8 format; this string of characters is then returned as a String. The details of the modified UTF-8 representation are exactly the same as for the readUTF method of DataInput.
Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.
